Body:
This is the first time I am working with ESP8266-01. My initial goal is to get a small WIFI IOT project like this Initial goal video

Till now the only thing I was able to achieve was getting it flashed (nodeMCU Flasher) to the latest lua nodemcu firmware(nodeMCU Firmware) via FTDI board. After flashing
column9:
I tried using the IDE for ESP8266 (ESPlorer) and see if I can get it to show me the uploaded firmware. But every time it just showed gibberish data (checked with all the baud rates).

I even tried using Arduino after updating the latest firmware using the bare minimum sketch
column10: but it again showed gibberish data (again checked with all the baud rates). I checked online multiple videos and tried each of them
column11: but nothing works. To keep a standard discussion
column12:
I was following this video video.

The setup I am using is
column13: - FTDI232 board with 3.3v output as an input to ESP	I read that FTDI can only supply enough juice to upload the firmware
column14: but what I am able to see is the FTDI 3.3v output supply gives 6v (open load)? Is this possible? The ESP works perfectly well at this voltage as I can see the red led glowing bright and blue LED flashing on first power ON. No heat nothing.	- I then used Regulated power supply 3.3V
column15:
but with this the ESP power Red LED was quite dim and blue LED never even flashed.

I have 5 ESP8266 board
column16:
tried with 3 of them. All having the same issue. So for sure I am missing something. Can anyone help me understand what I am doing wrong?

"

Body: Any news since a year now? I have the same problem as you

I did disconnect GPIO0 from ground. I switched off the supply and restarted. Is this what you mean by reset? If yes, I already did that. But if not, than I might have to try the other method of resetting. Can you please tell me how to do that?
Perhaps are you still in flashing mode ? After flashing you should disconnect GPIO0 from ground, and reset the ESP.

Flasher is giving me green signal once the firmware upgrade was finish. The log also says success on each line. So I am pretty sure the firmware was successfully updated. The only thing I am not able to work around with is the step after upgrading the firmware. I can't make it communicate using Sketch or ESPlorer. And I don't have any other thing connected during serial communication when I am working with ESP.

Yes this is what I mean, you could also connect briefly RST to ground. So perhaps firmware writing failed. Is there something in the log ? During firmware write, ESPlorer or esptool use the serial port, then you should not have other program like minicom/picocom connected to the serial during this phasis.
